title: Ticket #6578: VM_Memory ignores RESERVED_MEMORY
description: VM_Memory is supposed to reflect the memory available for VM's and it defaults to the entire memory capacity of the machine. However, RESERVED_MEMORY was added to allow admins to set aside memory that condor could not use. The default for VM_Memory should be total memory - RESERVED_MEMORY.
remarks:
2018-Feb-24 15:30:16 by tlmiller:
As far as I can tell, VM_MEMORY (the startd knob) defaults to undefined, and the VM universe will refuse to run without it explicitly being set. It's set to $(DETECTED_MEMORY) in /etc/condor/include/startd.conf, line 199, on the machine (e422) that we were looking at on Friday.
